name: Debolt Saline Water
description: The Project consists of three saline groundwater wells drilled into the Debolt aquifer, a sour water treatment plant; a water storage facility; water pipelines between the three groundwater wells and the treatment plant; and monitoring wells.

name: Aley Mine
description: Proposed 10,000 tonne per day open pit niobium mine 130 km north of Mackenzie, with a 25 year mine life.

name: Fortune Creek Gas
description: Quicksilver Resources Canada Inc. (the original Proponent) proposed to construct and operate a natural gas-processing facility in northeast British Columbia. On October 7, 2018 the current Certificate Holder (Nabors Drilling Canada Limited) confirmed that it had no interest in developing Fortune Creek Gas and operating the plant and let EAC E13-03 expire.

name: Arctos Anthracite
description: The proposed Project would involve developing a new open pit coal mine in north-western BC located about 90 km southeast of Iskut. With a production capacity of approximately 8,200 tonnes per day of clean coal, and a mine footprint of about 4000 ha, including an open pit of about 730 ha, the mine would produce about 3 million tonnes of coal for about 25 years. Transportation of the coal would be by rail to Ridley Terminals in Prince Rupert. The proposed Project would also include constructing a 147 km extension of an existing railway from its current terminus to the mine site.

name: Bull River Mine
description: Ktunaxa Nation submitted a request under Section 11 of the Environmental Assessment Act, 2018 for proposed amendments to Mines Act and Environmental Management Act permits and associated activities at he Bull River Mine be designated as a reviewable project under the Act.

name: Babkirk Secure Landfill
description: Upgrading three existing bioremediation cells at the facility to achieve the requirements of the Hazardous Waste Regulation for Secure Landfill Cells, providing a direct waste disposal option for the oil and gas industry. The Project will accept soil from the same sources as the existing facility, as well as desiccant material, sulphur catalyst and salt-impacted soil. The Proponents intend to retain current bioremediation capacity, while adding capacity for the permanent storage of 750,000 tonnes of waste soil. The Project has an anticipated lifespan of 25-30 years.

name: Babkirk Special Waste Treatment Facility
description: Upgrading three existing bioremediation cells at the facility to achieve the requirements of the Hazardous Waste Regulation for Secure Landfill Cells, providing a direct waste disposal option for the oil and gas industry. The Project will accept soil from the same sources as the existing facility, as well as desiccant material, sulphur catalyst and salt-impacted soil. The Proponents intend to retain current bioremediation capacity, while adding capacity for the permanent storage of 750,000 tonnes of waste soil. The Project has an anticipated lifespan of 25-30 years.

name: 29694 Marshall Road Extension
description: A sand and gravel pit located near the Abbotsford Airport.
proponent_name: Rigby Farmlands Limited and Little Rock Quarries

name: Spanish Mountain Gold Project
description: Spanish Mountain Gold Ltd. (SMG) proposes to develop the Spanish Mountain Gold Project (Spanish Mountain), an open pit gold mine with a production capacity of 20,000 tonnes per day, located six km southeast of Likely, British Columbia. Spanish Mountain is estimated to produce 7.3 million tonnes of ore/year with an operating mine life of 14 years, in addition to construction (2 years) and site decommissioning and reclamation (4 years) at a capital cost of $897.7 million. **Note: A similar project named Spanish Mountain Gold entered the EA process in 2011 and was withdrawn in 2019 at the proponent’s request.

name: Banks Island North Wind Energy
description: North Coast Wind Energy Corp. proposes to develop and operate a 700 MW wind power generation facility on Banks Island. Project consists of approx 250 to 350, 2.0 to 2.5 MW wind turbines and a transmission line to the BCTC grid south of the Skeena River

name: Bear River Gravel
description: Glacier Aggregates Inc. proposed to develop a gravel mine with a production capacity of up to 3.5 million tonnes per year from the lower reaches of the Bear River at Stewart, in northwestern B.C.

name: Bethlehem Extension
description: The Bethlehem Extension project involves restarting open-pit mining in the existing Iona and Jersey pits using the existing mine workforce. The project is an extension of the outer rim of the pits, typically 75 to 200 metres (m) in width, but potentially exceeding 600 m in the southeast direction.

name: Black Mountain Reservoir
description: The proposed Black Mountain Reservoir Project is an open surface raw water storage reservoir and associated pipelines. The reservoir site would be located in Gopher Flats at the foot of Black Knight Mountain north of Highway 33 in the City of Kelowna.

name: Big White Ski Resort Expansion
description: Westbank First Nation has submitted an application under s.11 of the Environmental Assessment Act, 2018 for a proposed expansion of Big White Ski Resort to be designated as a Reviewable Project under the Act.

name: Bingay Main Coal
description: Project proposes to develop a surface and underground coal mine with an annual production capacity of two million tonnes (Mt) in the Elk River valley, approximately 21 km north of Elkford, southeastern British Columbia.

name: Boundary Lake Sour Gas Plant
description: Boundary Lake Sour Gas Plant

name: Bronson Slope Gold and Copper Mine
description: The company is proposing to develop a copper/gold/silver/molybdenum mine on Bronson Slope near the existing Snip Mine, at Bronson Creek.

name: Basal Aquifer Dewatering
description: The Basal Aquifer Dewatering project increased the rate of groundwater extraction from the Basal Aquifer to extend the Highland Valley Copper Mine life. See the HVC 2040 project site for more information on a proposed amendment: https://projects.eao.gov.bc.ca/p/5cd9b4b56a15600025df0cc8/project-details

name: Bear Mountain Wind Park
description: The Project involves the construction and operation of a 120 megawatt wind park consisting of wind turbines, access roads, a transmission network and substation located 16 kilometres southwest of the City of Dawson Creek.

name: Bevan Avenue Wells Groundwater Supply Development
description: The Project consists of a modification to four existing groundwater wells. The project involves the Abbotsford-Sumas aquifer, and is in response to recent low surface reservoir levels associated with peak water usage in the summer months.

name: Big Silver Creek Waterpower
description: Run of River Project with a new transmission line in the Harrison Lake Area. Aggregate nameplate capacity is 79 MW.
proponent_name: Big Silver Creek Power Limited Partnership

name: Bodie Waste Dump
description: The Bodie Dump covers about 230 hectares and, upon completion, will contain some 127 million cubic meters of waste rock to support the continued mining of the Elkview Operations coal mine.

name: Brilliant Powerplant Expansion
description: Construction and operation of a new power plant adjacent to the existing Brilliant Dam and Brilliant Generating Station (BGS) on the Kootenay River located approximately 3 km upstream of its confluence with the Columbia River.

name: Brule Mine
description: Brule Mine is an open pit coal mine, with a production capacity of up to 2 million tonnes of PCI (pulverized coal injection) coal per year.

name: Kemess Underground
description: The proposed mine would produce 9 million tonnes per year and make use of the existing Kemess South open pit for tailings and waste rock storage, camp and processing facilities, electricity supply and roads. New infrastructure would include a 0.7 km tunnel, a 4 km access road as well as underground mining operations and processing facilities.

name: Burnaby Lake Rejuvenation Program
description: To rejuvenate the Burnaby Lake through a dredging program that will remove up to 400 000 cubic metres of sediment over an area of about 36 hectares and dispose of that sediment.

name: Chasm Solar and Energy Storage
description: Chasm BC Solar Project Limited Partnership proposes to develop the Chasm Solar and Energy Storage, a solar power-generation facility located approximately 10 kilometres north from Clinton, B.C.. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 100 megawatts per year of alternating current power generation. It would include solar panel arrays, battery storage system, overhead transmission lines, and access roads.
proponent_name: Chasm BC Solar Project Limited Partnership

name: Bute Inlet Hydroelectric
description: Plutonic Power Corporation's Hydroelectric Project will produce 914 MW through 3 groups of interconnected hydro facilities.

name: Carbon Creek Coal Mine
description: Cardero Coal Ltd. proposes to develop a metallurgical coal mine with an average annual production rate of 4.3 million metric tonnes of clean coal. The Project is located in northeastern BC, approximately 40 kilometres west of Hudson's Hope.

name: Cariboo Gold
description: Proposed open pit gold mine in Cariboo region. **NOTE: this is a project that was terminated in 2009. A new 'Cariboo Gold Project' (2020) is currently in the EA process: see https://projects.eao.gov.bc.ca/p/5d40cc5b4cb2c7001b1336b8.

name: CCS Sunrise Secure Landfill
description: CCS Corporation (Proponent) proposes to develop a new 65-hectare secure landfill located approximately 15 kilometers west of Dawson Creek, British Columbia.

name: Central South Mine
description: First Coal Corporation proposed to develop a new coal mine with a production capacity of 1.5 million tonnes per year and a life expectancy of 12 years.

name: Bulrush Natural Gas Production and Processing Facility
description: Construction and operation of a new raw gas processing plant and ancillary pipeline facilities in the Bulrush gas field, located approximately 100 kilometers north of Fort St. John

name: Burnco Aggregate
description: Burnco Aggregate Project is a sand and gravel mining operation, with a production capacity of up to 1.25 million tonnes per year of construction aggregates, over a 16 year life of mine.

name: Cache Creek Landfill Extension
description: Extension of the existing Cache Creek Landfill by 40 ha to provide an additional 15 million tonnes of disposal capacity.
proponent_name: Belkorp Environmental Services Incorporated and the Village of Cache Creek

name: Canada Line Rapid Transit
description: Ministers issued Environmental Assessment Certificate T05-01 on June 7, 2005.  Amendment No. 01 issued on Oct 20, 2005. Amendment No. 02 issued on Nov 29, 2005. Formally know as Richmond Airport Vancouver Rapid Transit Project. RAVP

name: Cape Scott Wind Farm
description: The Cape Scott Wind Farm Project (Project) formally know as Knobb Hill, was granted an EA Certificate September 21, 2004, to construct and operate a 450 MW wind farm comprised of 150 wind turbines.

name: Caribou Gas Processing Plant
description: Caribou Gas Processing Plant

name: Cascade Heritage Power
description: Cascade Heritage Hydro Project receives an Environmental Assessment Certificate for a proposed 25 MW run-of-river hydroelectric project on the Kettle River near Christina Lake

name: Cedar LNG

name: Line Creek Coal

name: Crown Mountain Coking Coal
description: NWP Coal Canada Limited proposes to develop the Crown Mountain Coking Coal Project, a metallurgical coal mine located approximately 12 kilometres  northeast from Sparwood, B.C.. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 2 million tonnes per year of clean coal. It would include an open pit coal mine, featuring surface extraction areas, a rail load-out facility and a clean coal transportation route as well as related infrastructure.

name: Chu Molybdenum Mine
description: Proposed open pit molybdenum mine 80 km southwest of Vanderhoof, BC, with an anticipated production of up to 90,000 tonnes per day

name: Coal Mountain Phase 2
description: The proposed Project would involve an extension of the Coal Mountain Operations mine, and would be located approximately 15 km south of Sparwood, BC. As an extension of existing operations, it would use the existing mine infrastructure at the Coal Mountain Operations mine. The production capacity would be approximately 2.25 million metric tonnes/year of clean coal with a mine footprint of about 1,000 ha. The mine would produce a total of 76.5 million metric tonnes of clean coal over the estimated mine life of 34 years.

name: Cranbrook Airport Expansion
description: The Corporation of the City of Cranbrook (Proponent) proposes to increase the length of the Cranbrook Airport runway from 6,000 ft (1,829 m) to 8,000 ft (2,438 m) and increase the size of the terminal from 851 m2 to 1,980 m2.

name: Cogburn Magnesium
description: North Pacific Alloys Limited proposes to develop a quarry and construct a magnesium processing facility near Ruby Creek. Proponent has requested a hold on this project untill after 2010.

name: Container Terminal 2
description: New container port with a completely separate terminal to the existing Deltaport Container Terminal located at  Roberts Bank.

name: Chilliwack Well 9
description: Municipal groundwater supply.

name: Coquihalla Pass Resort Development
description: Westscapes Development Incorporated proposes to develop an all-season resort located halfway between Hope and Merritt, near the summit of the Coquihalla Highway. The resort would consist of base village, golf course, ski lifts, and alpine trails.

name: Crab/Europa Hydroelectric Development
description: Kitamaat Renewable Energy Corporation proposes to construct and operate 2 run-of-river hydroelectric projects on the Crab (32 MW) and Europa (102 MW) rivers.

name: Copper Mountain New Ingerbelle Extension
description: The Copper Mountain Mine is an operating open pit copper/gold mine located in south-central British Columbia adjacent to and on either side of the Similkameen River approximately 20 km south of the Town of Princeton, B.C. This mine has been in operation since 1972 (prior to the Environmental Assessment Act) under authorizations through the Mines Act, Environmental Management Act, and other regulatory authorities. The proposed New Ingerbelle Extension would be an extension of the existing New Ingerbelle Pit and associated infrastructure by 298 ha, approximately 13% of the existing area of disturbance. The current designation request by Lower Similkameen Indian Band under review by the EAO requests for the Extension itself to undergo an environmental assessment process, in addition to Mines Act and Environmental Management Act authorizations.

name: Chemainus Wells Water Supply
description: New water supply for the District of North Cowichan near the Chemainus River to replace the aging Banon Creek water supply.

name: Cougar South/Main Pits and West Spoil Coal
description: The Project consists of open pit mining of coal from the Cougar South Pit and Main Pit, and the establishment of the West Spoil waste dump at the existing Greenhills Operations mine located approximately 8 km northeast of Elkford, B.C.

name: Coursier Dam Decommissioning
description: Project to decommission the Coursier Dam located near the outlet of Coursier Lake in the Columbia-Shuswap Regional District approximately\n30 kilometres due south of Revelstoke

name: Cranbrook Deep Wells
description: Certified October 15, 2004

name: Crowsnest Co-generation Plant
description: Project terminated by proponent

name: Crystal Peak Garnet
description: The Transition Order for the Crystal Peak Garnet Project has lapsed and the Project has been withdrawn from the environmental assessment process.

name: Davidson
description: Blue Pearl Mining Inc. (Proponent) proposes to develop an underground molybdenum mine with an anticipated production of 2000 tonnes per day with a mine life expectancy of 10 years.

name: Hermann Mine
description: Conuma Coal Resources Limited proposed to develop an open pit metallurgical coal mine with an estimated production capacity of 1 million tonnes per year and an estimated mine life of 10 years.

name: Dawson Liquids Extraction
description: The project consists of a natural gas liquids extraction facility with a design inlet capacity of 11.34 million m3/d (400 MMscf/d) of natural gas and a short interconnecting sales gas pipeline of up to 1,500 m in length.

name: Dokie Wind Energy
description: Proponent receives provincial approval for construction of a new wind farm with a nominal capacity of 300 MW with a preliminary layout of 200 1.5 MW turbines.

name: McLymont Creek Hydroelectric
description: Coast Mountain Renewable Energy Incorporated proposes to develop McLymont Creek Hydroelectric, a hydroelectric facility located approximately 100 kilometres northwest of Stewart, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to generate approximately 55 – 70 megawatts per year of alternating current power. It would include an intake structure, diversion channel, sluiceway, water conveyance system, powerhouse, tailrace, switchyard, transmission line, and access roads.

name: East Toba River Montrose Creek Hydroelectric
description: Hydroelectric Project located in the vicinity of Toba Inlet

name: Echo Hill Coal
description: Hillsborough Resources Limited proposed to develop a thermal coal mine with a production capacity of one million tonnes per year over an estimated mine life of 10-14 years.

name: Elk Gold
description: Gold Mountain Mining Corp. submitted a request under Section 12 of the Environmental Assessment Act (2018) for the proposed expansion of the Elk Gold Project to be designated as Reviewable Project.

name: Enbridge Northern Gateway
description: The Northern Gateway Project would involve the construction and operation of a terminal at Kitimat, British Columbia, and two 1,170 km pipelines between Bruderheim, Alberta and Kitimat. A 36 inch diameter export pipeline would carry oil products west to Kitimat, and a parallel 20 inch import pipeline would carry condensate east to Bruderheim

name: Deltaport Third Berth
description: Expansion of existing terminal at Roberts Bank. The project resumed the review of application on February 13 2006.

name: District of Chilliwack Groundwater Well
description: The Project consists of the following: well drilling and installation, pump house construction and electrical connection, water transmission main connection, and well operation.

name: Eagle Rock Quarry
description: Eagle Rock Materials Limited proposed to develop a rock quarry with a production capacity of 6 million tonnes per year.

name: Elkhorn Quarry Extension
description: The Project consists of an open pit gypsum mine, waste dumps, and an expanded sediment control system, located adjacent to an existing gypsum quarry operation on Windermere Creek.

name: Forrest Kerr Hydroelectric
description: Hydroelectric Project 100 km NW of Stewart on the Iskut River

name: Fort Nelson Electrical Generation
description: The Project will include the design, construction, operation, dismantling and abandonment of a 45 megawatt (MW) thermal powerplant to be located approximately 20 kilometres south of Fort Nelson, British Columbia.

name: Europa Creek Hydroelectric
description: A 230 KV transmission line from the Europa project to connect either near Kemano or near Kitimat and a new 83 MW Hydroelectric facility.

name: Pingston Creek Hydroelectric
description: The Project will consist of a 25 MW hydroelectric power plant on the western shore of the Upper Arrow Lake, about 60 km. south of Revelstoke. Water will be diverted from the Pingston Creek, a tributary of the Columbia River watershed, through a tunnel and a covered penstock. The power plant is expected to produce 130 GWh annually.

name: Farrell Creek 88-I South Gas Plant
description: The proposed Project involves a gas plant that will remove water and natural gas liquids from raw gas to meet transmission pipeline requirements.  The proposed Project would be developed in two or more stages, to an eventual build-out processing capacity of approximately 14.16 million cubic metres per day.

name: Encana 8-21 Refrigeration
description: Encana Corporation is proposing to construct a new natural gas processing facility located approximately 11 km west of Dawson Creek, British Columbia (BC). The proposed approximately 11 km west of Dawson Creek, British Columbia (BC). The proposed refrigeration facility would remove water and hydrocarbon liquids from 11.327 x 106 m3/day (400 MMscfd) of sweet raw gas produced from Encana's fields to meet transmission pipeline requirements.

name: Fraser River Forcemain Crossing
description: The Fraser River Sanitary Crossing Forcemain Upgrade is a proposed 90 centimeter diameter steel forcemain (pipe) under the Fraser River, which includes approximately 1,070 meter of main to be buried in the riverbed and 85 meter of main on land.

name: Fraser River Tunnel Project
description: Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure proposes to develop the Fraser River Tunnel project, an eight-lane immersed tube tunnel that will replace the George Massey Tunnel connecting Richmond and Delta, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to include an eight-lane immersed tube tunnel, a new eight-lane Deas Island bridge, associated connections to the existing Highway 99, and temporary construction facilities.

name: Fording River Extension (Castle)
description: Teck Coal Limited proposes to extend the lifespan of Fording River Operations, a coal mine located approximately 15 kilometers northeast from Elkford. The proposed project is anticipated to maintain a production rate of approximately 10 million metric tonnes per year of clean coal. It would include the use of existing infrastructure while mining directly south of existing operations in a proposed new mining area.

name: Frontier Project
description: Enbridge proposes to construct a natural gas liquids straddle plant, 130 to 170 kilometre (km) pipeline, and associated infrastructure in northeastern British Columbia. The straddle plant and initiating pump station are located approximately 36 km west of Chetwynd, and the pipeline is proposed to span from the straddle plant to Taylor.

name: Eskay Creek Mine
description: Mine Mill Expansion

name: Evergreen Line Rapid Transit
description: Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure is proposing to construct and operate an Advanced Light Rapid Transit (ALRT) connecting Burnaby,  Port Moody and Coquitlam, between Lougheed Town Centre in Burnaby and Douglas College in Coquitlam.

name: Fiberco Pulp Mill Expansion
description: Pulp Mill Expansion

name: Fording River Operations Swift
description: Fording River Operations Swift is an extension of Fording River Operations, producing a total of 170 million metric tonnes of clean coal over 25 years, and disturbing 1, 200 hectares of land not previously permitted for mining.

name: Garibaldi at Squamish
description: Garibaldi at Squamish consists of a year-round destination mountain resort community that includes a system of ski lifts and ski trails, a network of multi-use trails, resort accommodation and housing units, extensive guest services, public amenities, a groundwater supply system and associated infrastructure, and other recreation facilities.

name: George Massey Tunnel Replacement
description: The BC Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure proposes to replace the existing George Massey Tunnel across the South Arm of the Fraser River with a new bridge, replace the Westminster Highway, Steveston Highway and Highway 17A interchanges and widen Highway 99 to accommodate dedicated transit/HOV lanes between Bridgeport Road in Richmond and Highway 91 in Delta.

name: Gething Coal
description: CKD Mines Co. Ltd. is proposing to develop an underground coal mine with a production capacity of 2 million tonnes per year and an estimated mine life of 40 years.

name: Giant Copper
description: Proposed exploration mining activities in Upper Skagit River watershed.

name: Gold River Power

name: Glacier/Howser

name: GM Shrum Units 1 to 5 TRP
description: Proposed Project does not require an EA Certificate.

name: Grassy Point LNG

Maximum production of 20 million tonnes per year of liquefied natural gas. Note: Does not include pipeline to supply LNG facility. Pipeline (to be determined) would be provided by a 3rd party.

name: Baldy Ridge Extension
description: Teck Coal Limited proposes to expand Elkview Operations, an open coal mine located approximately 2.5 kilometres east of Sparwood. The proposed project is anticipated to increase production by approximately 6.8 million tonnes per year of clean coal. It would include expansions of existing infrastructure including mine pit excavations, waste rock spoils, storage and management of coal rejects and the potential relocation of administrative buildings and a utility corridor.

name: Hackney Hills Wind
description: Hackney Hills Wind Limited Partnership  proposes to develop a wind farm east of Fort St. John. The wind park has an estimated generating capacity of 370 MW.

name: Hackney Wind

name: Harper Creek

name: Hawkeye Energy Corporation Green Energy Grid
description: Hawkeye Energy Corporation (Proponent) proposes to construct an independent 151 MW hydroelectric project in the vicinity of the Toba and Jervis Inlets.

name: Heritage Secure Landfill
description: Secure Energy Services Inc. is proposing to develop the Heritage Secure Landfill Project approximately five kilometres south of Tupper, BC.  The Project would provide long-term containment of upstream oil and gas and other industrial waste streams.

name: Giscome Quarry and Lime Plant
description: Giscome Quarry and Lime Plant consists of a lime processing facility and quarry with a production capacity of 600,000 tonnes per year and an estimated mine life of 25 years.

name: Greenville to Kincolith Road
description: Public Highway Improvements

name: Hart Water Supply Improvements Fishtrap Island Collector Well
description: The City of Prince George proposes the construction and operation of a groundwater collector well and pump station that has a proposed 1,079 litres/second volume of groundwater extraction. Ancillary components will include two water transmission mains in the vicinity of the Nechako River approximately 7km upstream of its confluence with the Fraser River.

name: GM Shrum Generating Station Upgrade
description: This project was determined not reviewable by the Environmental Assessment Office; therefore, a Section 10(1)(b) was issued on March 12, 2007.

name: Highland Valley Centre for Sustainable Waste Management
description: Regional landfill proposed on a waste rock and overburden dump at the Highland Valley copper/molybdenum mine with a capacity of 50 million tonnes of municipal solid waste (up to 600,000 tonnes per year) from throughout south-western BC.

name: Jumbo Glacier Resort
description: Glacier Resorts Limited proposed to develop a year-round ski resort development in the Jumbo Creek valley, 55 kilometres west of Invermere.

name: Highway Gas and Liquids Plant and Pipeline
description: Highway Gas and Liquids Plant and Pipeline

name: Highland Valley Copper Refinery
description: Project involves the construction and operation of hydrometallurgical copper refinery on its existing mine site. If constructed the refinery would produce copper cathode plates and be in operation by 2010.

name: Horizon Mine Coal

name: Hot Springs Road Gravel Quarry
description: Hot Springs Road Gravel Quarry consists of a 7 hectare gravel pit with a production capacity of 120,000 tonnes of gravel per year. It is located 4.2 kilometres north of Agassiz, BC, on private land.

name: Inland Pacific Connector
description: Awaiting supplementary information from proponent. Proponent has until March 2013 to supply supplementary information to resume review.

name: Isle Pierre Wind

name: Jedney Gas Plant & Pipeline Expansion
description: The proposed Jedney Expansion Project consists of a raw gas pipeline, a gas processing facility, an acid gas disposal scheme, a hydrocarbon liquids pipeline and truck loading facilities, a small expansion of the existing Jedney camp, and associated facilities.

name: Kamloops Energy Recovery
description: Project terminated by proponent

name: Holberg Wind Energy

name: Huckleberry Copper and Gold Mine

name: Interior-Lower Mainland Transmission

name: Island Cogeneration
description: A cogeneration project to produce steam for the Fletcher Challenge Elk Falls paper mill and electricity for sale to B.C. Hydro.

name: James White Park Wells

name: Kamloops Airport Expansion
description: The Kamloops Airport Authority Society proposes to expand the Kamloops Airport to accommodate larger jet aircraft.  The project includes expansion of the main runway and airport terminal building, as well as improvements to navigational aids.

name: Kitimat LNG Terminal
description: Kitimat LNG Inc. Operating Partnership proposes to construct and operate the Kitimat LNG Terminal, a liquefied natural gas import regasification and pumping terminal at Emsley Cove,14 kilometres south of Kitimat, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to receive and store LNG unloaded from tankers, regasify the LNG into natural gas and deliver the gas via an 18 kilometre pipeline to Kitimat. The Kitimat LNG import terminal will be designed to receive LNG carriers with a capacity of up to 250,000 metric tonnes and have a send-out capacity of 610 million standard cubic feet per day.

name: Rocky Creek Metallurgical Coal Project
description: CTI Plus Resources Ltd. Proposes to develop the Rocky Creek Coal Mine, a Metallurgical Coal Mine located approximately 60 south of Chetwynd BC. The proposed project is anticipated to include an annual production of 3 million tonnes of raw coal over a mine life of up to 16 years. CTI Plus Resources Ltd. is a Canadian resource company based in Calgary, Alberta.

name: Kemess North Copper-Gold Mine

name: Kamloops Groundwater
description: EA Certificate was issued on April 13, 2004.

name: Kingsvale to Oliver Natural Gas Pipeline Reinforcement

name: Kinskuch Hydro

name: Keenleyside Powerplant
description: Name change. Now known as Arrow Lakes Generating Station.

name: Kitimat Clean Refinery
description: Kitimat Clean Ltd. (Proponent) proposes to develop and operate an oil refinery and associated infrastructure to supply refined fuels to Asian markets. Refined fuel products would be delivered from the refinery site, approximately 13 km north of Kitimat, to a new marine terminal, approximately 12 km south of Kitimat harbour, using three 23 km long pipelines and from there transported by ship to Asia. The Kitimat Clean Refinery Project (Kitimat Clean) would be in operation for up to 50 years, following a construction period of up to 5 years. The Proponent expects decommissioning to take an additional 5 years.

name: Kemess South
description: A gold/copper mine project in north central B.C. approximately 300 kilometres northwest of Mackenzie. The project is estimated to contain a mineable reserve of 4.1 million ounces of gold and 990 million pounds of copper.

name: Klinaklini Hydroelectric
description: New run-of-river hydroelectric project with an average generatiing capacity of 280 MW of power.

name: Kitsault Mine

name: Kokish River Hydroelectric
description: Proposed amendment to increase the maximum diversion rate from 23.3 cubic metres per second to 25 cubic metres per second.

name: KSM
description: The Kerr-Sulpherets-Mitchell Project is a proposed copper and gold open pit mining project located 65 km NW of Stewart BC.

name: Kutcho Copper-Zinc-Silver-Gold Mine
description: Kutcho Copper Corp. proposes to develop a copper-zinc-silver-gold deposit with an anticipated production capacity of 912,500 tonnes per year and a mine life expectency of approx. twelve years. Note: this project is withdrawn. For information on the current Kutcho Project, please see:  https://www.projects.eao.gov.bc.ca/p/5d9774f9862e090021f6057b

name: Kutcho

Bitumen would be shipped in a near-solid form called neatbit in rail cars using existing rail infrastructure.zoned site locally known as Dubose Flats. name: Tranquille on the Lake
description:
Stk’emlupsemc te Secwépemc Nation submitted an application to the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Strategy to designate Ignition Tranquille Developments Ltd.’s proposed housing development Tranquille on the Lake project a reviewable project. Reviewable projects require an environmental assessment certificate to proceed. 
Tranquille is a proposed residential development with resort-like amenities planned on approximately 190 hectares of land within the municipal boundaries of the City of Kamloops, in and around the Tranquille River and bordering the north shore of Kamloops Lake. The project includes approximately 1500 permanent homes, a 266-acre mixed use farm, a winery, a guest house with a maximum of 24 beds, a hotel or country inn with a range of 80 to 120 rooms and and residential amenities such as convenience stores. The construction work force will bean estimated average of 154 full time jobs per year for approximately 14 years.

It would include a coal processing plant and an open pit mine, featuring storage piles, surface water management features, water supply wells, mine haul roads, a power line, a rail loadout facility and rail loop, and related infrastructure.

description: Run of River Project with a new transmission line in the Harrison Lake Area. Aggregate nameplate capacity is 79 MW.

name: Vancouver Island Cable
description: Proposed High Voltage Direct Current ( HVDC ) Light transmission system between Vancouver Island and the lower mainland.

name: Tulsequah Chief Mine
description: The Project is an underground copper, gold, zinc lead and silver mine located in northwestern BC, approximately 30km from the Canada-US border, 64 KM northeast of Juneau, Alaska.

name: Tumbler Ridge Wind Energy
description: Tumbler Ridge Wind Energy Limited Partnership (the proponent) proposes to construct and operate 33 wind turbines with an installed capacity of 49.6 MW. The purpose is to provide clean energy for BC and has a life span of at least 25 years.

name: Upper Harrison Water Power
description: Proponent receives provincial approval to construct five interconnected run-of-river hydroelectric facilities at the north end of Harrison Lake, with a combined generating capacity of 102 MW. Projected investment is between $225,000,000 and $300,000,000.
proponent_name: Tipella Creek Project Limited Partnership, Lamont Creek Project Limited Partnership and Upper Stave Project Limited Partnership.

name: Upper Toba Valley Hydroelectric
description: Upper Toba Hydro Inc.  proposes to construct 3 run-of-river hydroelectric projects with a total capacity of 120MW. Major components include Dalgleish Creek 30MW, Jimmie Creek 50MW, and Upper Toba River 40 MW with 230KV transmission line

name: Vancouver Airport Fuel Delivery
description: The Vancouver Airport Fuel Facilities Corporation proposes a marine terminal on the south arm of the Fraser River, an adjacent fuel storage facility, and a 15 kilometre pipeline to YVR to meet future demand for fuel at the airport.

name: Vancouver Convention Centre Expansion
description: Certificate signed by Ministers' July 28 2004.
proponent_name: Vancouver Convention Centre Expansion Project Limited

name: Vancouver Island Generation
description: Powerplant

name: Vancouver Island Transmission Reinforcement
description: Upgrade of existing tranmission corridor (69 km) with two new 230 kV circuits with a life span of 50 years.

name: Vintage Landing Resort and Wellness Village
description: 622664 BC Ltd. proposed to develop a resort and wellness village with hotel(s) and conference centre; hillside and beach bungalow resort accommodation units; beach club facility and marina; and a golf course and associated clubhouse in Kelowna, BC. This project was determined not reviewable by the Environmental Assessment Office and an Exemption Order, under Section 10(1)(b) of the Environmental Assessment Act (2002), was issued on November 3 2005.

name: Westham Canoe Pass Tidal Marsh
description: Proposed creation of a habitat banking site along the southeast shore of Westham Island in Canoe Pass by Port Metro Vancouver.

name: Wapiti Power Development
description: AESWapiti Energy Corporation proposed to develop the Wapiti Power Development Project, comprised of a 184 MW thermal electric power plant, a 35 kilometre transmission line and a surface coal mine with a production capacity of 750,000 to 850,000 tonnes per year. The Project was withdrawn from the B.C. environmental assessment process on June 7, 2012.

name: WCC LNG
description: WCC LNG Project Ltd. (Proponent) is proposing the development and operation of the WCC LNG  Project in Tuck Inlet, within the city limits of Prince Rupert. The proposed Project will include production, storage, transfer, and loading of LNG onto LNG vessels for marine transportation to offshore markets.

name: WCOL Natural Gas Liquids (NGL) Recovery
description: West Coast Olefins Ltd. (WCOL) is proposing to construct a Natural Gas Liquids (NGL) Recovery Project which includes an NGL extraction plant and an NGL separation plant to recover propane, butane and natural gas condensate (collectively known as natural gas liquids, or NGLs). The Project is located near Prince George, BC.

name: Waneta Generating Station Upgrade
description: Amendment to Mitigation and Compensation plan as required under EAC E97-01. Original Project consisted of three replacement turbines and related equipment at Waneta Generating Station increasing capacity approximately 106 MW, utilizing diversion of an additional 224 cubic metres per second of water
proponent_name: Teck Metals Limited and BC Hydro and Power Authority

name: Waneta Hydroelectric Expansion
description: Proposed new 435 MW hydroelectric generation station on the right bank of the Pend d'Oreille River.

name: Wildmare Wind Energy
description: Finavera Renewables Inc. proposes to construct and operate 37 wind turbines with an installed capacity of 74 MW. The purpose is to provide clean energy for BC and has a life span of at least 25 years.

name: Wartenbe Wind Energy
description: Construction of a new wind farm, with a nominal capacity of 70.5 MW with a preliminary layout of 47 turbines.

name: Wolverine Secure Landfill
description: Tervita Corporation is proposing to develop a secure landfill approximately 48 km northwest of Dawson Creek, BC (formerly known as CCS Wolverine Secure Landfill Project).

name: West Stoddart Gas Processing Facility
description: Gas Processing Facility

name: Westcoast Connector Gas Transmission
description: The Proponent plans to develop a natural gas transmission system from the Cypress area in northeast BC to the Prince Rupert area. It will include 851 km to 872 km of 912 mm to 1219 mm diameter pipeline and up to five compressor stations.

name: WGSI LNG Storage
description: LNG Storage Facility

name: Younger NGL Plant Expansion
description: The Project will consist of the installation of a third natural gas processing train within the existing plant boundary.

name: Whistler Nordic Centre
description: The Whistler Nordic Centre, a component of the 2010 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games, consists of Nordic competition facilities, trails and associated infrastructure and roads, and non-competition recreation trails and facilities.

name: Willow Creek
description: Willow Creek Coal Mine consists of an open pit coal mine with a production capacity of 900,000 tonnes per year and a 15 year mine life.

name: Smithers Regional Airport Runway Expansion
description: This project was determined not reviewable by the Environmental Assessment Office therefore a Section 10(1)(b) was issued on September 20, 2007

name: Coyote Hydrogen
description: Canada Fortescue Future Industries proposes to develop Coyote Hydrogen, a hydrogen and ammonia processing facility located approximately 12 kilometres from Prince George, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 140,000 tonnes of hydrogen per year and 700,000 tonnes of ammonia per year through the use of sustainable hydroelectric energy. The proposed green project would include production, storage and unloading components for hydrogen and ammonia, infrastructure to divert water and wastewater treatment, process cooling units, and power supply systems.

name: Coastal GasLink Pipeline
description: Coastal GasLink Pipeline Limited has completed the Coastal GasLink Pipeline, a natural gas transmission pipeline running 650-kilometer between the community of Groundbirch near Dawson Creek, to the LNG Canada export facility near Kitimat, B.C. The project is anticipated to transport 2.1 billion cubic feet day with the potential for expansion up to approximately 5 billion cubic feet day. It will also include up to 8 compressor stations.

name: Cabin Gas Plant
description: Enbridge G&P Canada Limited Partnership is constructing the Cabin Gas Plant, a natural gas processing plant located approximately 60 kilometres northeast of Fort Nelson in the Horn River Basin. It is comprised of two gas plants: Gas Plant 1 which is nearing completion and partially operating, and Gas Plant 2, which is partially constructed. When complete, Cabin Gas is expected to produce over 5.5 million cubic metres of natural gas a day.

name: LNG Canada Export Terminal
description: The proposed Project consists of the construction and operation of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant and associated marine terminal facilities for the export of LNG to Asian markets. To review more regulatory information please visit https://lng.gov.bc.ca/

name: Eagle Mountain - Woodfibre Gas Pipeline
description: Fortis BC Energy Vancouver Island Inc. (the Proponent) is proposing to construct and operate an approximately 47 km long 24 inch diametre natural gas pipeline from the area north of the Coquitlam Watershed in the Greater Vancouver Regional District (Metro Vancouver) to the Woodfibre Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) facility, southwest of Squamish, British Columbia (B.C.); additional compression at existing compressor stations at Eagle Mountain in Coquitlam; a new compressor station in Squamish; and metering facilities at the receipt and delivery points.

name: Ksi Lisims LNG
description: Nisga'a Nation, Rockies LNG Limited Partnership and Western LNG LLC proposes to jointly develop Ksi Lisims LNG, a liquified natural gas processing plant and marine terminal, located on the northern end of Pearse Island near Kitimat, B.C. Ksi Lisims LNG proposes to process 12 million tonnes per year of liquefied natural gas project to create approximately 575 to 695 billion cubic feet per year of natural gas. The project includes temporary storage facilities on two permanently installed floating liquid natural gas structures.
proponent_name: Nisga'a Nation, Rockies LNG Limited Partnership and Western LNG LLC

name: North Montney Mainline Pipeline
description: The North Montney Mainline Pipeline Project would include the construction and operation of a 305 km, 42 inch diameter natural gas pipeline in the Peace River Regional District, along with associated metering facilities, valve sites and possible compression facilities. The project would connect with the existing Groundbirch Mainline (Saturn Section), located about 35 km southwest of Fort St. John.NEB Website link:https://www.neb-one.gc.ca/pplctnflng/mjrpp/nrthmntn/index-eng.html

name: Dawson Creek Liquid Nitrogen Plant
description: The Project is a modification to the already substantially complete liquid nitrogen plant being built within the city boundaries of the City of Dawson Creek. The major inputs in the creation of liquid nitrogen are air and electricity. The only by-product of the process is clean water and oxygen. The land on which the project is situated is privately owned by Ferus Inc. (the Proponent) and is zoned for industrial use. The existing facility will produce 180 tonnes of liquid nitrogen per day, and the additional facility will produce the same, bringing the total to 260 tonnes/day or 131,400 tonnes/year. The Proponent has been advised by the BC Archeology Branch that archaeological records for the parcel of land on which the project site is located do not indicate the presence of a known archaelogical site, nor any potential for an unrecorded archaeological site.

name: Jordan Solar and Energy Storage
description: Jordan BC Solar Project Limited Partnership proposes to develop the Jordan Solar and Energy Storage, a solar power-generating facility located approximately 20 kilometres northwest of Sooke, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 100 megawatts per year of alternating current power generation. It would include solar panel arrays, a battery storage system, overhead transmission lines, and access roads.
proponent_name: Jordan BC Solar Project Limited Partnership

name: West Coast Olefins Ethylene
description: West Coast Olefins Ltd. proposes to construct and operate an ethylene production plant located in Prince George, British Columbia. The West Coast Olefins Ethylene project is anticipated to produce 1 million tonnes per year of polymer grade ethylene, with an expected lifespan of 25 years.

name: Sukunka Coal Mine
description: Glencore plc proposed to develop and operate a surface mining operation and coal handling and processing plant to produce hard coking coal for export to overseas steel manufacturers. A B.C. environmental assessment certificate will not be issued for the Sukunka Coal Mine Project.

name: Peace Valley Oriented Strand Board
description: Peace Valley OSB is located on the southeast side of Fort St. John, B.C., 1.5 kilometres (km) north of the Alaska Highway and 1 km southwest of the Fort St. John airport, on Swanson Lumber Road. It has been in operation since 2005 and produces commodity thicknesses of Oriented Strand Board (OSB).

name: Red Mountain Underground Gold
description: IDM Mining Ltd. proposes to develop an underground gold mine in the Bitter Creek Valley located near Stewart, in northwest British Columbia. The Project will extract high-grade gold and silver ore to be processed on-site in the Bitter Creek Valley

name: Richmond Island Milltown Marina and Boatyard
description: The Musqueam Indian Band and Bastion Development Corporation are proposing to develop a commercial marina for recreational vessels at Richmond Island.  The proposed development would include boat launch, boat gantry crane, gangway and ramps, dredging of slough, approximately 9,000 linear feet of dock space for 174 in-water moorage slips, dry-stack storage for up to 250 boats, parking for 228 vehicles, 5,000 square feet (280 sq. m) space for a marine trades and boat repairs, 7,000 square feet  (650 sq. m) space for a cafe, marine supplies store, caretaker's residences and other commercial uses. Installation of water, sanitary and electric connections,  creation of a habitat island,  pedestrian and cycling pathway along an existing access road connecting Bentley Street to Richmond Island,  public observation point, and an accessible park.
proponent_name: Musqueam Indian Band and Bastion Development Corporation

name: Ch́’ḵw’elhp Well Field
description: Sunshine Coast Regional District (SCRD) proposes to develop the Ch́’ḵw’elhp Well Field project, a groundwater extraction project located approximately 3 kilometers northeast of Gibsons, BC. The proposed project is anticipated to transport 74 liters per second and transport the water off site to a water treatment and storage facility. It would include the development of three production wells, a pump station, water treatment infrastructure, and two water mains - one for untreated water and one for treated water - to connect the well field to the municipal water supply system.

name: Tilbury Phase 2 LNG Expansion
description: FortisBC proposes to expand Tilbury Phase 2 LNG, a liquid natural gas facility located on Tilbury Island in Delta, BC. The proposed project is anticipated to increase the capacity of the current facility by over 160,000 cubic meters of liquid natural gas and increase the LNG production capacity of the facility up to 11,000 tonnes per day through the construction of a storage tank, liquefaction facilities and supporting infrastructure.

name: Prosperity Gold-Copper
description: Taseko Mines Limited of BC proposes to develop a high volume open pit gold-copper mine located 125 km SW of Williams Lake in South Central British Columbia.

name: Air Liquide Liquid Nitrogen Plant
description: The Project is a modification to the already substantially completed liquid nitrogen plant being built within the city boundaries of the City of Dawson Creek.  The major inputs in the creation of liquid nitrogen are air and electricity.  The only by-product of the process is clean water and oxygen.  The land on which the project is situated is privately owned by Air Liquide Canada Inc. (the Proponent) and is zoned for industrial use. The existing facility will produce 200 tonnes of liquid nitrogen per day, and the additional facility will produce 250 tonnes/daily, bringing the total to 450 tonnes/day or 164,250 tonnes/year.

name: Galore Creek Copper-Gold-Silver
description: Galore Creek Mining Corporation proposes to develop Galore Creek Copper-Gold-Silver project, an open pit copper, gold and silver mine located approximately 150 kilometres northwest of Stewart, B.C. The project has an anticipated production capacity of approximately 60,000 tonnes per day of ore over the anticipated 25-year lifespan of the mine. It would include open pits, a processing plant, a tailings storage facility, and an access road that is approximately 140kilometre long.

name: Highland Valley Copper Mine Life Extension
description: Teck Highland Valley Copper Partnership proposes to modify the operating Highland Valley Copper (HVC) mine by developing Highland Valley Copper Mine Life Extension, an expansion of the existing copper and molybdenum mine located approximately 17 kilometres west of Logan Lake, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to increase the mine’s production capacity and extend HVC’s mine life by at least 18 years and would produce an average of approximately 178,000 tonnes per day of ore. It would include an extension to the existing open pit, as well as expansions to some mine site infrastructure and processing facilities to support the increased production capacity.

name: Brucejack Mine
description: Pretium Resources Inc owns and operates the Brucejack Mine, an underground gold and silver mine located approximately 65 kilometres north-northwest from Stewart, B.C.. The project is able to produce approximately 2,700 tonnes per day of ore over a minimum 16-year lifespan of the mine. It includes the mine site and associated facilities, an access road and ancillary infrastructure.

name: Eskay Creek Revitalization
description: Skeena Resources Ltd. proposes to develop the Eskay Creek Revitalization Project, an open pit gold-silver mine located approximately 135 kilometres south of Iskut, B.C. and 83 kilometres northwest of Stewart, at the site of the past-producing underground Eskay Creek Mine. The proposed project would have the capacity to produce approximately 3.7 million tonnes per year of gold and silver-bearing ore. It would include the development of mine site and associated infrastructure, transmission line upgrades, and the transportation of concentrate to the port facilities in Stewart.

name: Mt. Milligan Copper-Gold
description: Thompson Creek Metals Company Inc. operates the Mt. Milligan Copper-Gold project, a mineral mine located approximately 90 kilometres northeast of Fort St. James, B.C. The project has the capacity to process approximately 21.9 million tonnes per year of copper and gold-bearing ore. It includes open pit mining over 15 years, road access, a transmission line from Mackenzie to the mine site, and a rail shipping facility at Mackenzie.

name: Encana 4-26 Refrigeration
description: Encana Corporation is proposing to construct a new natural gas processing facility located on the 241 Road approximately 16 km west of Dawson Creek, British Columbia (BC). The proposed refrigeration facility would remove water and hydrocarbon liquids from 11.327 x 106 m3/day (400 MMscfd) of sweet raw gas produced from Encana's fields to meet transmission pipeline requirements.

name: Aspen Solar and Energy Storage
description: Aspen BC Solar Project Limited Partnership proposes to develop the Aspen Solar and Energy Storage, a solar power-generating facility located approximately 50 kilometres southeast from Merritt, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 100 megawatts per year of alternating current power generation. It would include solar panel arrays, battery storage system, overhead transmission lines, and access roads.
proponent_name: Aspen BC Solar Project Limited Partnership

name: GCT Deltaport Expansion - Berth Four
description: GCT Canada Limited Partnership proposes to expand the existing marine shipping facility at the GCT Deltaport Terminal with Berth Four, a marine terminal located approximately 12 kilometres southwest from Delta, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to increase the international shipping capacity of the facility to up to two million twenty-foot shipping containers per year. It will include the expansion of the existing terminal container storage and handling area, the addition of a fourth berth on the southeast side of the Roberts Bank Causeway, and expansion of the existing intermodal rail yard. It would include a 44-hectare expansion of the terminal for container handling and storage, a 560 metres berth extension, a 12 hectare expansion of the existing intermodal rail yard, and a barge berth to accommodate future potential demand for short distance sea shipping capability.

name: Blackwater Gold
description: Project consists of the extraction of gold and silver from an open pit mine, and ore processing facilities with a milling rate capacity of 60,000 t/d (22 Mt/y), over 17 years. The proposed Project is located approximately 110 km south of Vanderhoof. Project footprint consists of the mine site, mine access road and a new 133 km transmission line that connects the mine site with the existing substation to provide power to the Project.

name: Line Creek Operations Phase II
description: Teck Coal Limited proposes to expand Line Creek Operations, a coal mine located approximately 22 kilometers northeast from Sparwood, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 3.5 million tonnes per year of clean coal. It would include an open pit mine, featuring transportation and electrical infrastructure, waste rock spoils, surface water management systems and related infrastructure.

name: Angus
description: Vitreo Minerals Ltd. proposes to develop the Angus silica sand mine located approximately 60 kilometres north of Prince George near Bear Lake. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately two million tonnes per year of silica sand. Silica sand, sometimes called ‘proppant,’ is used in hydraulic fracturing to prop open the fractures that are created during crude oil and natural gas extraction. The project would include an industrial mine quarry featuring a raw sand plant, water management infrastructure, waste rock and fines stockpiles, finishing plant and related infrastructure.

name: Michel Coal
description: North Coal Limited proposes to develop the Michel Coal Project, a coal mine located approximately 15 kilometres (km) southeast from Sparwood, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 2.3-4 million tonnes per year of raw coal. It would include an open pit mine, featuring mine pit excavations, rock stockpile areas, water management systems and related infrastructure.

name: Trans Mountain Expansion
description: Trans Mountain Pipeline ULC has completed the Trans Mountain Expansion, an approximately 1,000 kilometer pipeline between Edmonton, AB and Burnaby, B.C. The expansion is anticipated to triple the capacity of the Trans Mountain pipeline system and will increase the capacity of the Westridge Marine Terminal in Burrard Inlet from 5 medium-sized tankers per month, to a maximum of 34.

name: Kinskuch Hydroelectric
description: WindRiver Power Corporation proposes to develop the Kinskuch Hydroelectric Project, a 50 to 80 megawatt power project located approximately 150 kilometres north of Terrace, BC. The Project consists of a dam and storage reservoir at Kinskuch Lake and a tunnel, penstock, power house and transmission line in the upper Kinskuch River system and Nass Valley.

name: North Thompson Emergency Water Intake
description: Proposed by the City of Kamloops; project involves diverting water into wells for retrieval during drought periods. Project proposes to divert water from the North Thompson River for emergency water supply use should the primary water source for the City of Kamloops be unavailable.

name: Highland Solar and Energy Storage
description: Highland BC Solar Project Limited Partnership proposes to develop the Highland Solar and Energy Storage, a solar power-generation facility located approximately 15 kilometres south of Ashcroft, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 150 megawatts per year of alternating current power generation. It would include solar panel arrays, battery storage system, overhead transmission lines, and access roads.
proponent_name: Highland BC Solar Project Limited Partnership

name: Roberts Bank Terminal 2
description: This is a new container terminal proposed by Port Metro Vancouver at Roberts Bank in Delta, BC, approximately 35 kilometres south of Vancouver. The proposed Project is a new three-berth marine container terminal that would provide additional capacity of 2.4 million Twenty-foot Equivalent Units (TEUs) of containers per year to meet anticipated demand until 2030.

name: Parkland Burnaby Refinery
description: Parkland Refining (BC) Limited, a division of Parkland corporation, is proposing the construction of 8 storage tanks at the Parkland Burnaby Refinery.

name: Cariboo Gold Project
description: Osisko Development Corp. is developing the Cariboo Gold project, an underground mineral mine located at Wells. The project will have the capacity to process approximately 1.1 million tonnes per year of gold-bearing ore. It will include underground mining over 16 years, ore milling at the Quesnel River mine approximately 58 kilometres southeast of Quesnel, storage of waste rock at the Bonanza Ledge Mine near Barkerville, and a transmission line from the Quesnel area to the mine.

name: Campbell River Water Supply
description: The Campbell River Water Supply Project includes construction and operation of approximately 2.5 km of 1.2m diameter water main pipe, intake, diversion of approximately 12 million cubic meters of surface water, control structure/pump station and relocated water treatment processes.

name: Kootenay West Mine
description: CertainTeed Canada Inc.’s Kootenay West Mine gypsum quarry is located approximately 12 kilometres northeast from Canal Flats, B.C. and anticipated to produce approximately 400,000 tonnes per year of gypsum. The project includes an open pit gypsum quarry featuring mine site access roads, mine rock storage facilities, stockpiles and related infrastructure.

name: Kimberly Water Reclamation Centre
description: [Proponent name] proposes to develop the [project name], a [project type] located approximately [distance] kilometers [N/E/S/W] from [known near population centre/known near landmark/start and end locations of project]. The proposed project is anticipated to [produce/store/etc] approximately [storage capacity/production yield/etc.] per year of [product]. It would include [describe major project components].

name: Tilbury Marine Jetty
description: Tilbury Jetty LP proposes to develop the Tilbury Marine Jetty, a marine port facility, located at Tilbury Island on the Fraser River in Delta, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to transfer up to 4.83 billion cubic metres of natural gas per year. It would include the construction of a permanent jetty, a temporary floating bunker berth and supporting infrastructure, the shipping of liquified natural gas, and dredging.

name: Nass Valley Regional Transmission Line
description: [Proponent] proposes to develop the [Project name], a [project type] which would be located approximately [distance]km from [known near population centre/known near landmark] within the boundaries of [the QQQ Region]. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately [production yield] per year of [product], and would include [describe major project components].
proponent_name: Nisga’a Nation as represented by the Nisga’a Lisims Government

name: Comox Valley Water Treatment
description: Comox Valley Regional District proposes the construction and operation of a water treatment plant near the City of Courtenay, on the central east coast of Vancouver Island. The CVWT project consists of a water intake, pumping station, the water treatment plan, and connecting pipelines.

name: Inga North Gas Plant Modification
description: ConocoPhillips Canada is proposing to add sulfur removing equipment to the Inga North Gas Plant, an existing natural gas processing plant near Wonowon. approximately 90 km northwest from the city of Fort St. John. The proposed modifications to the Inga North Gas Plant do not meet the thresholds to automatically require an environmental assessment; however, because the Inga North Gas Plant produces more than 125,000 tonnes of greenhouse gasses per year, the proponent is required to notify the Environmental Assessment Office (EAO) of any modifications, to determine if an environmental assessment is necessary.

name: Centerm Expansion
description: The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority proposes to construct a series of improvements to the existing Centerm container terminal, as well as to off-terminal road and rail. The expansion to container capacity and related off-terminal improvements are intended to meet anticipated near-term demand for containers to be shipped through Vancouver.

name: Summit Lake PG LNG Project
description: JX LNG Canada Ltd. proposes to develop Summit Lake PG LNG, a liquid natural gas processing plant located approximately 30 kilometers north from Prince George, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 10,060 thousand cubic metres per day of natural gas and 2.7 million tonnes per year of liquid natural gas. It would include incoming gas facilities, gas treatment facilities, liquefaction facilities, LNG storage facilities, product loading facilities, cooling systems, flare systems, fire and gas systems, and firefighting facilities.

name: Wonowon Landfill
description: Secure Energy Services Incorporated proposes to develop the Wonowon Landfill, located approximately 9 kilometers southeast of the community of Wonowon in the Peace River Regional District. The proposed hazardous waste project is anticipated to have direct disposal capabilities to accept contaminated soils (including those containing more that 3% hydrocarbon) from spill cleanups and site remediation, drilling waste from oil and gas exploration and production, industrial waste, and forestry waste. Based on the site’s acceptance, it is proposed that the site will have approximately 200,000 tonnes of waste annually for 25 to 75 years depending on usage.

name: Resort Municipality of Whistler - Drinking Water Well Enhancement
description: The Resort Municipality of Whistler is requesting an exemption under S.10(1)(b) for a new groundwater extraction project, well 219, which will exceed the Reviewable Projects Regulation of 75l/s for groundwater extraction.

name: Prince Rupert Gas Transmission
description: Prince Rupert Gas Transmission Limited proposes to develop the Prince Rupert Gas Transmission pipeline between Hudson’s Hope to the proposed Pacific NorthWest LNG natural gas liquefaction and export facility on Lelu Island near Prince Rupert. The project consists of both land-based and marine sections of pipeline. Depending on the final route, the pipeline could include up to 780 kilometres of land-based pipeline with a diameter of over 1.2 metres and up to 120 kilometres of twin marine pipelines approximately a meter in diameter. The proposed project is anticipated to produce approximately 2 billion cubic feet per day with the potential of expansion up to approximately 3.6 billion cubic feet per day.

name: Ridley Island Energy Export Facility
description: Ridley Island Energy Export Facility GP Inc., on behalf of Ridley Island Energy Export Facility Limited Partnership, is building Vopak Pacific Canada, a bulk liquid petroleum storage and marine export facility located approximately 10 kilometres south of Prince Rupert near Port Edward. The project is anticipated to store up to 98,000 cubic metres of liquified petroleum gas, 260,000 cubic metres of light diesel and gasoline, and 220,000 cubic metres of methanol. It would include the construction and operation of bulk liquids storage facility, including a new jetty at Ridley Island. The proposed project is anticipated to store liquified petroleum gas (e.g., propane, ethane, butane), methanol, light diesel and/or gasoline.

name: Delta Grinding Facility
description: Heidelberg Materials Canada Limited proposes to develop the Delta Grinding Facility, an industrial grinding facility with a marine terminal located approximately 5 kilometres north of Delta, B.C., on Tilbury Island. The proposed project is anticipated to manufacture 650,000 tonnes of supplementary cementitious material (SCM) per year, a key resource for less energy intensive concrete. It would include a facility for manufacturing SCM adjacent to its existing cement production facility, a new marine terminal, stockpile areas, mill system, truck loadout facility and related infrastructure.

name: Sparwood Wells #04
description: The District of Sparwood constructed a water system that may trigger the Reviewable Project Regulation. The EAO is currently waiting for information on the design to understand if the project triggers the threshold. The water system is located approximately 4 kilometres northeast of the junction of highways 3 & 43, within the District of Sparwood. It includes a well, pumphouse and related infrastructure.

name: Revelstoke Generating Station Unit 6
description: BC Hydro and Power Authority proposes to develop the Revelstoke Generating Station Unit 6, a modification to an existing hydroelectric facility located on the Columbia River, approximately 5 kilometres north of Revelstoke, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to produce an additional 500 megawatts of power per year at the Revelstoke Generating Station. It would include installing a 500 megawatt generating unit and related equipment and the construction of office buildings, parking areas and warehouse facilities.

name: Silverberry Secure Landfill
description: Tervita Corporation proposes to expand the Silverberry Secure Landfill, a solid waste management facility, located approximately 50 kilometres northwest of Fort St. John, B.C. The proposed project is anticipated to store up to 5,275,000 cubic metres of additional waste. Infrastructure and facilities already in operation for the existing landfill will be used for the expansion. Stormwater, leachate management and monitoring systems will be expanded or upgraded where appropriate.

name: Inga Gas Plant Expansion
description: ConocoPhillips Canada is proposing to expand the Inga Gas Plant, an existing natural gas processing plant southeast of Wonowon, B.C. and northwest from the city of Fort St. John, B.C. The proposed expansion would increase the capacity of the Inga Gas Plant to receive and process natural gas, natural gas liquids and produced water. This proposed expansion of the Inga Gas Plant does not meet the thresholds to automatically require an environmental assessment; however, because the Inga Gas Plant produces more than 125,000 tonnes of greenhouse gasses per year, the proponent is required to notify the Environmental Assessment Office of any modifications, to determine if an environmental assessment is necessary.
